'''Direct3D''' is a proprietary Microsoft library for hardware-accelerated rendering. On Windows systems, [[ZDoom]] uses it to display 2D images (such as [[HUD]] elements, [[menus]], and so on), as well as to display the rendered scene, but '''not''' to render the scene itself.
Features allowed by Direct3D include support for [[image format|truecolor images]] (without forcing them into the palette) and support for {{CVAR|R|vid_adapter|choosing on which monitor to display}}.
In case of incompatibility between Direct3D and the graphic hardware used, the console variable {{CVAR|R|vid_forceddraw}} can be set to true so as to use the older {{wp|DirectDraw}} library instead. [[Category:Glossary]][[Category:Technical aspects]]
